intro: Haplopappus calendulaceus, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, with the outer bracts resembling petals. Haplopappus calendulaceus is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
